items.preText: Dilip: "So how do you expect imrul kayes being an opener to make a comeback,bat @ no 5 and perform for the team?"
items.text: slower ball, full and outside off. He caresses the drive but can't get past mid-on

items.text: first boundary of the innings came forward and drove this nicely, opening the face of the bat to pierce the gap between cover and mid-off and the timing was very good. races to the fence.

items.text: beaten floats this outside off and draws him forward, but it's perhaps the carrom ball and spins away from him just enough to beat the bat. Shahzad whips off the bails and they go upstairs, but he had dragged his foot back in time

items.text: goes straighter and flatter that time, allowing him to go back in his crease and nudge it towards square leg

items.text: gets it to turn from outside off again, and the batsman's prod is beaten

items.text: fuller outside off, he comes forward and defends solidly

items.preText:
Shahbaz Dogar : "I can see lot of pre 2000 era of bating here in asia cup. All teams arw struggling against each other at initial stage of the game."

Ajboss: "How good is Mujeeb. He always manages to take a wicket in the powerplay. As good as Rashid Khan is I think Mujeeb is very underrated because I've never seen a better bowler in the powerplay for a long time."
items.text: back of a length on the stumps, opens the face of the bat to guide it to third man
items.shortText: Gulbadin Naib to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: top edge goes to the boundary dug it in short, well directed and rising to the batsman's head. He goes for the hook and gets a thickish top edge but it's safe because there's no one fine

items.text: on the pads and turned to square leg

items.text: well timed, but point puts in a tumble to his right to stop the drive

items.text: defended to point again. full ball on the stumps

items.preText: Michael: "For us with even the vaguest knowledge of cricket, we can't help but respect AFG for their meteoric rise out of the rubble of the nation that's known exclusively for the war. You'd expect their credentials to be half decent considering the nation was born out of disputed land between IND-PAK, yet I don't think there are enough superlatives to describe their progression. They're an Associate nation no longer. " - well they're not an Associate nation technically too, having been granted Full Member status now, but I get your point
items.text: comes down the track, but is beaten and struck on the pads. The bowler belts out an appeal, but he was too far down

items.text: dropped at slip went back to cut it, but only got a thick edge. Shahzad was right up to the stumps and it deflected off his gloves. It was at comfortable catching height to first slip's left but he couldn't hold on

Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Lots of love for the absent Mominul. Here's Saikot: "How on earth BD selectors have the audacity and ignorance to consider Mominul Haque as "not a limited over cricketer" while he proved himself as one, scoring big runs in shorter version pretty regularly in domestic cricket and for A team lately. And the guy has a good temperament and solid technique not to say. either BD selectors rely on some sort of intuition as a selection criteria or they are corrupted. A pissed off almost middle aged fan from Bangladesh."
items.text: length ball on off, and he comes forward to defend
